definition: no thought for tea or rice (idiom); melancholic and suffering/to have no appetite

sentences.english: Now, I do hardly want to take a meal, for I almost have too few cash to take one.
sentences.chinese: 现在我真的是茶饭不思啊，因为我都快没钱吃饭了。

sentences.english: D. His wife's disease took apart his appetite.
sentences.chinese: 妻子的病令他茶饭不思。

sentences.english: It lets countless adolescent have no appetite for food, bedraggled and normal school work.
sentences.chinese: 它让无数青少年茶饭不思，荒废正常的学业。

sentences.english: D. His wife's disease took away his appetite.
sentences.chinese: 妻子的病令他茶饭不思。

definition: to bathe one's face in tears (idiom)
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
to be preoccupied (idiom)/to be inattentive/to be frightened out of one's mind
to be unable to sleep at night
hundred knots of worry in one's intestines (idiom); weighed down with anxiety
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
lit. to eat without tasting the food/worried or downhearted (idiom)
to fall gravely ill, never to recover (idiom)
